return.name: database_server
return.description: Database hostname or IP address. "localhost" or "127.0.0.1" is generally used.

return.name: database_port
return.description: Database port number. Usually 3306 works here for mysql.

return.name: database_type
return.description: Database type... (currently only mysqli is fully supported!)

return.name: database_name
return.description: Database name. This is usually prefixed with your username when on shared hosting, eg: userfoo_site.

define.name: SSL_MODE
define.description:
Select what type of SSL operation you want for the site. Please be forewarned that you should probably have SSL already setup before enabling it! 
disabled - SSL is disabled completely.
ondemand - SSL is allowed only on secure pages, while non-secure pages redirect to non-ssl.
allowed  - SSL is allowed on any page throughout the site, and required on secure pages.
required - SSL is always required for all pages.

define.name: SITENAME
define.description: The site name that can be used for emails and page titles.

return.name: site_url
return.description:
If a site url is provided and not blank, force the servername to match it. Useful for restricting access to www.domain.com. Please note, if you set this to an invalid location, you or anyone else will not be able to access the site.

Do not include the http:// prefix!

define.name: SERVER_ADMIN_EMAIL
define.description: Set this to an email address, (or comma-separated list for multiple), to receive server health reports and critical errors.

define.name: DEVELOPMENT_MODE
define.description: Check if this site will be used in a development environment. Extra debugging information and verbose error messages are enabled if this is checked.

define.name: SESSION_COOKIE_DOMAIN
define.description: If you would like to enforce a domain to be used for your cookies, set that here. For example, if you have sites on example1.domain.com, example2.domain.com, and www.domain.com, setting this value to ".domain.com" is recommended to have the sessions shared.

define.name: FTP_USERNAME
define.description:
For any local file write access, providing the FTP username, password, and base directory will utilize an FTP connection instead of direct writing.

This is useful for running the site as "www-data" or "apache" users, but having the files owned by a different user.

define.name: FTP_PASSWORD
define.description: FTP Password

define.name: FTP_PATH
define.description: FTP Root Path

define.name: CDN_TYPE
define.description: The CDN type for asset and public files. Choose "local" if you don't know what this means.

define.name: CDN_LOCAL_ASSETDIR
define.description: The asset (JS, CSS, Images, etc), resources that get access directly by the browser.

define.name: CDN_LOCAL_PUBLICDIR
define.description: The user-supplied and admin-supplied public uploads that get access directly by the browser.

define.name: CDN_LOCAL_PRIVATEDIR
define.description: The user-supplied and admin-supplied private uploads that cannot be accessed directly.

define.name: CDN_FTP_USERNAME
define.description: FTP Username to push/pull files over an FTP connection for use as a CDN.

define.name: CDN_FTP_PASSWORD
define.description: FTP Password to push/pull files over an FTP connection for use as a CDN.

define.name: CDN_FTP_HOST
define.description:
FTP base path to push/pull files over an FTP connection for use as a CDN.

This is usually a fully resolved path starting and ending with a slash.

define.name: CDN_FTP_PATH
define.description:
FTP base path to push/pull files over an FTP connection for use as a CDN.

This is usually a fully resolved path starting and ending with a slash.

define.name: CDN_FTP_URL
define.description:
The URL used as a base for all FTP CDN resources. This must be the URL form of your base CDN_FTP_PATH variable.

eg: If your FTP path is /home/user/public_html/content/, then your URL may be cdn.domain.tld/~user/content/.

You do not need to include the HTTP:// or HTTPS:// prefix, as that is added automatically.

define.name: CDN_FTP_ASSETDIR
define.description: The asset (JS, CSS, Images, etc), resources that get access directly by the browser.

define.name: CDN_FTP_PUBLICDIR
define.description: The user-supplied and admin-supplied public uploads that get access directly by the browser.

define.name: CDN_FTP_PRIVATEDIR
define.description: The user-supplied and admin-supplied private uploads that cannot be accessed directly.

define.name: AUTO_INSTALL_ASSETS
define.description: Auto-install any modified asset resource when in DEVELOPMENT_MODE and using a local CDN.

define.name: XHPROF
define.description: Set to a value greater than 0 to enable the XHprof profiler that percentage of the time. For example, setting to 100 will enable the profiler on every page; setting to 50 will enable the profiler on 50% of the page views.

return.name: tmp_dir_web
return.description: The location of the tmp directory for cache, compile, and general temporary files. This directory MUST be writable by the apache user. Please ensure that this ends with a "/"

return.name: tmp_dir_cli
return.description: The location of the tmp directory for anything on the CLI that needs temp storage. Please ensure that this ends with a "/"

define.name: TIME_GMT_OFFSET
define.description: The number of seconds this machine is off from the current GMT time.

define.name: TIME_DEFAULT_TIMEZONE
define.description: The default timezone to display times in.

define.name: PORT_NUMBER
define.description: Port number server is listening on for normal connections.

define.name: PORT_NUMBER_SSL
define.description: Port number server is listening on for secured connections.

return.name: cache_type
return.description: Either "file" for a cache on the filesystem or "memcache" if Memcached is available for a cache in system memory.

define.name: DB_PREFIX
define.description: Set this to something non-blank if you are running this system on the same database as other software.

define.name: DMI_QUERY_LOG_TIMEOUT
define.description:
Set to a number >= 0 to record queries that take that long in milliseconds to execute. AKA "slow query log".
(Hint, most reads should complete within 4ms and writes should complete within 10ms, otherwise something may be wrong with the server.)

  • Set to "-1" to disable query logging altogether (default)
  • Set to "0" to log all queries to logs/query.log
  • Set to "10" to log queries taking longer than 10ms to logs/query.log
  • Set to "1000" to log queries taking longer than 1 second to logs/query.log
  • Set to "2000" to log queries taking longer than 2 seconds to logs/query.log
  • etc...

define.name: DEFAULT_DIRECTORY_PERMS
define.description:
Default directory permissions to use for the system.
				If security oriented, set as 0755.
				If convenience is more important, set to 0777.

define.name: DEFAULT_FILE_PERMS
define.description:
Default file permissions to use for the system.
				If security oriented, set as 0644.
				If convenience is more important, set to 0666.

define.name: ALLOW_NONXHR_JSON
define.description:
Debug variable, set this to true to allow calling *.json pages explicitly. By default this is set to false, so that json requests cannot proceed without at least the HTTP_X_REQUESTED_WITH header being set correctly.
This by far is not an acceptable security measure to protect these assets, more of just a quick patch to keep the common passer-byer away from json data.

define.name: SECRET_ENCRYPTION_PASSPHRASE
define.description:
The encryption key used for sensitive information that must be saved in the database and retrieved as plain text. Storing the passphrase with the code is required beccause the encrypted data must be visible via the application.
This does provide one level of security however, that is if the database is leaked, it would be difficult to decrypt those bits of information without the correct pass phrase.
!!! IMPORTANT !!! Once you set this and start using the site, DO NOT CHANGE IT! Doing so will make the encrypted data unusable!
